quote: I use AI for things that allow me to gather information or get information about what I can visit in a given country.
I plan what I can visit on a given day in a country so I don't have to travel from one end of the city to the other.
It's best to get around a city using the metro, public transport like trams, buses, or trains.
I know AI is constantly learning and you should use it sensibly, because not all information is verified.
It would be best if it showed verified information, not fake, Linux.
That in the future it could help with everyday life, but not replace face-to-face contact.
I'm not an expert, and whether for this particular illness I need to go to a specialist immediately or can I wait for an appointment?
With a calendar it could remind me of things I've saved there.
A coffee machine, a fridge that would inform me that something has run out.
AI still can't fully express itself correctly in a given language, so I preferred to communicate with a person in that regard.
Grammar problems, and artificial intelligence cannot replace face-to-face conversations.
In contrast, when I speak face to face, I can see how the person reacts to the questions, how they answer, what their facial expressions are.
